item.title: Covid in Scotland: Most restrictions to end from 9 August
item.description: Social distancing will no longer be required in most locations - but the wearing of face coverings will continue.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Self-isolation of whole classes 'no longer routine'
item.description: Secondary school pupils will be still be asked to wear face coverings in classrooms for at least the first six weeks of term.

item.title: Scottish stadiums will allow 5,000 fans without prior permission
item.description: Scottish football clubs can welcome at least 5,000 fans to games from 9 August, but must still apply to their local authority for permission to host more.

item.title: Grandfather lands 'biggest ever cod' in Scottish waters
item.description: The fish caught off Shetland weighed in at 49lbs (22kg) and left 60-year-old Tony Urwin "shattered".

item.title: Would you move to an island for £50,000?
item.description: The Scottish government is proposing an Islands Bond to encourage young people to stay or move to the islands.

item.title: Scotland's growing sewage spill problem
item.description: The number of overspills into rivers and seas has risen by 40% in five years as pressure mounts on the sewer network.

item.title: I stopped drinking - then baking business turned my life around
item.description: Lesley Smith gave up alcohol for the sake of her children but had "no outlet" until she found a passion for making cakes.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Scots cycling trio secure silver medals as Reekie misses out on 800m medal
item.description: Four cyclists take silver medals, but Jemma Reekie narrowly misses out on a 800m medal on a busy day for the Scots at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: COP26 'should be hybrid event' says former climate chief Figueres
item.description: The main architect of Paris Agreement says the summit will need to be a mix of virtual and in-person meetings.

item.title: Teenage driver dies in two-car crash near Dunkeld
item.description: The A9 was closed for a number of hours following the crash near Dunkeld at about 17:00 on Monday.

item.title: Lossiemouth's long-awaited £1.8m beach footbridge approved
item.description: A £1.8m crossing giving access to East Beach in Lossiemouth is approved, two years after the former structure was ruled unsafe.

item.title: Humza Yousaf reports nursery over discrimination fears
item.description: Health Secretary Humza Yousaf says his daughter was twice refused a place at the nursery, which denies any discrimination.

item.title: Fire-hit Crannog Centre given £51,000 cash boost
item.description: The Scottish government funding could be used to help rebuild another Iron Age roundhouse beside Loch Tay.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules at level zero?
item.description: The whole of Scotland has now moved to level zero, but what does that actually mean people can do?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?
item.description: The documents could be used in an international vaccine passport programme enabling foreign travel.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: COP26: How is Scotland tackling climate change?
item.description: The Scottish government says its targets are some of the toughest in the world - but what progress is being made?

item.title: Six ways to tackle Scotland's drugs crisis
item.description: What can be done to try to halt Scotland's rising toll of drug-related deaths?

item.title: Adopting the recovery position
item.description: Banks are taking money out of their bad loan pots and larger companies in Scotland are reflecting activity overseas.

item.title: The seaweed farmers with high hopes for their harvest
item.description: Kelp grown off the coast of the Isle of Skye could be used in food, packaging and cosmetic products.

item.title: 'Luxury' race will be among most expensive on earth
item.description: A four-day ultramarathon covering 120 miles on the west coast of Scotland will cost £15,499 to enter.

item.title: Overflows: ‘There is raw sewage going into the river’
item.description: Data shows that the number of recorded sewage spills in Scotland has increased by 40% over the last five years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: John Gimson and Anna Burnet win silver for Britain in mixed Nacra 17 class sailing
item.description: John Gimson and Anna Burnet secure silver for Great Britain in the mixed Nacra 17 class.

item.title: Humza Yousaf reports nursery over discrimination fears
item.description: Scotland's health secretary says his daughter was twice refused a place at the nursery, which denies any discrimination.

item.title: Covid: US family reunited with Scottish relatives after 20 months
item.description: Elaine Burt was reunited with her sister and nephews, who live in the USA, at Glasgow airport.

item.title: Duncan Scott's parents on 'tremendous' Tokyo Olympics success
item.description: The parents of Scottish swimmer Duncan Scott share their joy as their son takes home a record Olympic medal haul.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Katie Archibald, Jack Carlin and Neah Evans eye Paris gold after Tokyo silvers
item.description: Scotland's Katie Archibald, Jack Carlin and Neah Evans set their sights on gold in Paris 2024 after having to settle for silver in Tokyo on Tuesday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Silver for GB in women's team pursuit as Germany set world record again
item.description: Germany's women's pursuit team set a new world record for the third race in a row to take the Olympic title ahead of Great Britain.

item.title: Malmo v Rangers: Steven Gerrard expects 'physically strong' challenge
item.description: Steven Gerrard anticipates a "physically strong" challenge from Malmo in Rangers' Champions League qualifier.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jason Kenny equals medal record with silver in men's team sprint
item.description: Jason Kenny wins a record-equalling eighth Olympic medal with team sprint silver, Netherlands win gold.
